DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare effect certain contrast agent ( iodixanol ) two commonly use contrast agent call Iopamidol ( Isovue ) iohexol ( Omnipaque ) , heart kidney safety patient undergoing cardiac CT angiogram . The investigator evaluate whether iodixanol 320 ( Visipaque® ) , iso-osmolar agent , well tolerate ( flush , injection site pain/warmth , headache , nausea ) provide equal image quality compare iohexol 350 ( Omnipaque® ) Isovue 370 64-slice multidetector compute tomography angiography ( MDCTA ) . A fourth group ( Visipaque 270 ) include , use low radiation dose technology acquisition , evaluate image quality , tolerability , contrast enhancement compare Visipaque 320 Omnipaque Isovue . In addition image quality , tolerability , contrast enhancement , investigator evaluate heart rate , adverse event , reimaging , cost , patient satisfaction among four cohort . The study recruit 400 participant already undergo CT angiography consent randomize one four group . Each possible contrast agent use commonly used CT angiography , primary risk loss confidentiality ask question tolerability . All facet study ( 3 lead ECG , beta blockade , nitroglycerine use , CT angiography contrast administration ) standard care do clinical us .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Contrast Agents During CT Angiography
DOC.criteria: Subjects may include study meet follow criterion : 1 . The subject 18 year old . 2 . Subject schedule undergo contrastenhanced CCTA examination 3 . The subject contraindication receiving iodinate contrast administration ( allergy , renal insufficiency ) . 4 . The subject provide sign date informed consent Exclusion criterion : Subjects must exclude participate study meet follow criterion : 1 . Subjects know contraindication contrast administration : Renal insufficiency define GFR < 50 Known contrast allergy 2 . Pregnant possibly pregnant subject exclude Women childbearing potential undergo urine pregnancy test prior CT scanning .
